intro: Spermacoce saxicola, commonly known as rock spermacoce, is a flowering plant native to arid and rocky regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in crevices and on rocky outcrops, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Spermacoce saxicola is often found in succulent karoo vegetation, where it plays a role in local biodiversity.
